articles.title: Is Deere’s Precision Agriculture Push Justifying the Current Share Price in 2025?
articles.mainIdea: Is Deere’s Precision Agriculture Push Justifying the Current Share Price in 2025?
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: Is Deere’s Precision Agriculture Push Justifying the Current Share Price in 2025?. If you are wondering whether Deere is still a buy after its long run, you are not alone. This breakdown will help you decide if the current price makes sense or if patience might pay off. Despite a solid long term track record, with shares up 86.8% over five years and 13.2% over three, the stock has cooled recently, slipping 2.8% over the last week and 4.1% over the past month, while still sitting 11.8% higher year to date and 9.5% over the last year. articles.title: Deere to Scale Customer-Focused Mixed-Fleet Business with Tenna Buyout
articles.mainIdea: Deere to Scale Customer-Focused Mixed-Fleet Business with Tenna Buyout
articles.summary: Zacks: Deere to Scale Customer-Focused Mixed-Fleet Business with Tenna Buyout. DE plans to scale its mixed-fleet strategy with the Tenna acquisition, expanding customer-focused construction technology offerings. Related tickers mentioned: CR, FLS, WTS.

articles.title: Forget FMC: Instead Buy This Unstoppable Farming Titan That's Up 11% in 2025 and Still Running
articles.mainIdea: Forget FMC: Instead Buy This Unstoppable Farming Titan That's Up 11% in 2025 and Still Running
articles.summary: Motley Fool: Forget FMC: Instead Buy This Unstoppable Farming Titan That's Up 11% in 2025 and Still Running. There's a better option available for investors bullish on the agricultural sector. Related tickers mentioned: FMC, ^GSPC.
